content.body: mumbles something about not believing that he's actually defining a fricking event loop algorithm but not seeing any sane way around it
Why do I read public-html and whatwg?
gsnedders: Because it's relevant to your interests (and future employment, maybe even)
We are the Priests/Of the Temples of Syrinx
was hoping that gsnedders was setting up a "why does the chicken cross the road" type joke
jgraham: No, I wasn't.
jgraham: I guess I'm relying on the fact my T-shirt says, "Maybe if this shirt is witty enough someone will finally love me" for wit.
gsnedders: I suggest using an HTML5 parser that can be configured to follow the infoset coercion rules and, thus, maps space characters to XML S.
hsivonen: I have no need for the output to match XML, though
gsnedders: it makes the Toolchain work
I realised half an hour ago that normalize-space(translate(., "\x0C", " ")) would work fine
it takes almost 9 minutes to compile the parser into JS on 2.4 GHz Core Duo

hsivonen: Why does http://validator.nu/?doc=http://www.teamfortress.com/ say "Error: Required attributes missing on element map." on the <map name="home">? I don't see any attributes required other than 'name'
Philip`: interesting.
Philip`: are you seeing similar bogus messages on other elements?
hsivonen: Not that I can see
Maybe something (maybe me) is getting confused because XHTML requires id instead of name?
Philip`: oh. right. it's not the HTML5 schema
HTML 4.01 Transitional apparently
Sounds like that's a known issue, given http://about.validator.nu/#ideas
tries to figure out why </body> hangs in the Web mode of GWT, although the code works right in Hosted mode
Is there any debugging support for the Web mode?
Philip`: Firebug :-)
Philip`: but it's not useful due to the obfuscation
(GWT RC2 introduced a bug in the non-obfuscated compiler mode, so that's no good)
Sounds like fun
anyone from the US around?
yay. the GWT compiler bug causing the hang is one of those bugs that stops being a bug when observed
(inserting alerts fixes the problem--presumably by foiling some compiler "optimizations")
nvm
encounters https://mail.mozilla.org/pipermail/es-discuss/2008-August/003400.html
(which indicates still requiring content-type opt-in to the new version, but promoting putting it in <script type> instead of HTTP content-type)
Don't everybody talk at once, now
Xenos, it's usually quiet in here on weekends
Ahh
Until someone explodes, at least
fortunately, exploding people are an infrequent occurrence. Though, it's messy when it does happen.
(Don't worry about me, I'm just talking about a mixture of Nabokov on IM, primarily Lolita and Ada or Ardor)
How do you represent exploding people in text format?
explodes
*BOOM*
Xenos: ^^
Ahh
Either work.
Doesn't seem so messy to me :p
You can't see myself or Lachy now.
Xenos, you'd think differently if you saw my screen right now
This is true. I am impressed by your disembodied selves still handling your keyboards, though :p
Xenos: I don't have a keyboard, I just have diodes attached to various bits of brain splattered across this room
Ah :P
Now, let me try and reassemble myself so I can go to bed.
hehe
is wondering if he can be bothered to not be lazy for long enough to apply to uni in the US
Why would you apply for uni in the US?
I mean, rather than somewhere civilized :p
IMO (which by definition is not humble), there are better places for CS in the US than anywhere else
And it really would be a successful means of running away from everyone I know
Hmm, I thought there were Indian places that were supposed to be better
don't remember any names tho
That it would, I guess :P
But I don't speak Indian :)
(There again, I doubt many people from my school would be going to Cambridge, for example)
English is an official language there, I'd guess most CS education happens in that :P
And Latin is the official language of the Vatican, but not everything is in Latin there :P
hehe
There are some regions that don't even speak Hindi
Like Fife, Scotland?
lol
Or is that not the region you meant? :P
Wow, there are 415 different mother tongues within India, 29 of which are spoken by more than 1 million people, 122 by 100k+
Well, I can speak English. I can sorta speak French, and I can understand some German.
Oh, and I can read a fair amount of Latin.
Then I guess Hindi is next on the list? :P
Nah.
I hate langauges :)
hehe
Besides, "We're only immortal for a limited time", so why spend that time learning languages? :)
:p
It keeps the alzheimers away
:p
(That's an awesome lyric, though)
http://current.com/items/89204971_death_star_over_san_francisco nice
Photoshop'd!
hehe
I didn't know you could edit vids there :p
No, you can't, but meh!
Thought it was kinda cool anyway :p
The longer anything goes on for, the less it makes sense.
How so?
is just quoting myself out of context
(to give it a slight bit of context, there's a girl who constantly flirts with me, and just generally acts as if she wants me, denies it and will do nothing with me)
That makes sense, every time you do anything in return that makes it seem that you want her validates her
Boosts self-esteem, makes her feel more attractive, etc. She might not even be consciously aware of continually flirting
has already got into far too long discussions about this
Anyhow, it doesn't not make sense :p
"talking to you is like taking a ride in a mobius loop" — molly
(as it always ends up back on the subject of that girl :P)
is hopeless
(Actually, I'm not, I'm far too hopeful, but I digress, and I ought to shut up now)
You really like this girl, eh?
Xenos: I have shut up.
The general rule in such situations is GFTOW.
Go F*ck Ten Other Women. If you're still in love with her after you might have real problems :P
… Xenos says completely naïve of the fact I've just got out of months of seeing a psychologist :P
Good. Most people should see a good psychologist for some time :p
And if you've quit that means you're better, right?
In terms of what was causing me to be suicidal, yes
That death star video is awesome :-)
Ya :p
it's quite well made. Some of the shots look quite realistic
But only some :(
Yup
Some
yeah. The one with the landing didn't quite work well due to some minor camera movement
you can see the ship shifting slightly as the camera moved
g'nite guys
The lighting's wrong :)
(on the death star)
http://xkcd.com/331/
